article.headline: Amazon says over 19,000 of its employees have caught COVID-19
article.body: Amazon workers sort and pack items at a fulfilment center in 2019. AFP/Getty Images Amazon.com Inc. on Thursday said more than 19,000 of its workers — out of the 1.37 million it employs worldwide — have tested positive for COVID-19 or are presumed to have had the virus. “We have been conservative in this analysis. First, we cast a wide net by including both confirmed and presumptive cases in the Amazon figures,” the e-commerce giant said in blog post disclosing a data analysis. “Second, actual COVID-19 rates in the general population are greater than the official counts because not everyone in the general public gets screened for symptoms or tested. “ Amazon AMZN, +3.01% employees are regularly screened for symptoms and are increasingly being tested at work, regardless of whether they are showing symptoms, to identify asymptomatic cases, according to the company.
